head.supplied: Melbourne, ¶ 16 April 1889. ¶ T. R. Wilson Esqr &c ¶ Under Secretary. ¶ Sir....

div.p: N89/5413, unit 431, VPRS 3992/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;

div.p: A typed copy of this letter was prepared at the Chief Secretary's Office and filed separately without the attached estimates (N89/5953, unit 431, VPRS 3992/P, Public Record Office, Victoria). Melbourne,

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;
font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt;
font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt;
font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt;
font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt;

div.p:
In accordance with the request, conveyed in your letter of the 5th inst. (N. 2353)
Letter not found. I have the honor to submit the estimates of the Gov. Botanist's Department for the finance-year 1889-1890. I have ventured, to write them out in such alterations, as would be brought about, were the promotions in the staff and the slight addition be approved of, such changes having been solicited in my letter of the 30 March,
See M to A. Deakin, 30 March 1889. and the reasons for it seriatim been explained then.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt;

div.p: Trusting, that the alterations and improvements, proposed for the establishment under my care, will receive generous consideration, I have the honor to be, Sir,

font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: center;
p.seg: ESTIMATES of Expenditure for the Year ending 30th June, 1890.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3335in; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: Estimates written by Georg Luehmann and signed throughout by M. There are two copies of the estimates in the file, the second copy does not bear the annotations that were presumably made a the Chief Secretary's Office.
